channel.title: Atlanta – Chow Down Orlando
channel.description: Exploring all that Orlando has to offer.

item.title: On the Road: Phish Phood
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
This is another installment of Chow Down Orlando on the road, this time from Atlanta. The final stop on our greater Atlanta trip was Phish Phood, a sandwich shop that’s opened for lunch and dinner in the Roswell area. It’s a very cool neighborhood spot that is serving up food with a good amount of love […]

The post On the Road: Phish Phood appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
This is another installment of Chow Down Orlando on the road, this time from Atlanta.

The final stop on our greater Atlanta trip was Phish Phood, a sandwich shop that’s opened for lunch and dinner in the Roswell area. It’s a very cool neighborhood spot that is serving up food with a good amount of love and care.

We got a Ricky Ricardo, which is basically a fancy cuban with pork that they smoke in house. The other is the TunaPhish Pocket, which is kicked up tunafish in a peta. Both were served with Phish Chips and we asked for a side of their sweet thai chili blueberry sauce because it sounded so great.

The food was wonderful as were the friendly staff and owners. If we lived in the area, Phish Food would be on that list with Pom Pom as one of our go to places.

Next time you find yourself in Roswell, GA, give Phish Phood a try.

The post On the Road: Phish Phood appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.

item.title: On the Road: The Flying Biscuit
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
This is another installment of Chow Down Orlando on the road, this time from Atlanta. The Flying Biscuit is an Atlanta area chain that is a must stop. It serves breakfast all day along with sandwiches and other favorites. I have never had a bad meal from a Flying Biscuit. What you see pictured are […]

The post On the Road: The Flying Biscuit appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
This is another installment of Chow Down Orlando on the road, this time from Atlanta.

The Flying Biscuit is an Atlanta area chain that is a must stop. It serves breakfast all day along with sandwiches and other favorites. I have never had a bad meal from a Flying Biscuit.

What you see pictured are organic, oatmeal pancakes with a peach compote topping, a chicken biscuit potpie, and a breakfast platter with grits, eggs, chicken sausage, and their famous biscuits.

The thing about the food at the flying biscuit is that it’s just so good. Biscuits are served with an apple cranberry butter that is just awesome. The chicken pot pie has plenty of submerged biscuits to add to the flavor. And the biscuits themselves have just the right amount of sugar on the top to give it that extra something special.

The Flying Biscuit can be found in the greater Atlanta area and, for some reason, in Gainesville, FL.

The post On the Road: The Flying Biscuit appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.

item.title: On the Road: Googie Burger
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
This is another installment of Chow Down Orlando on the road, this time from Atlanta. It’s pretty clear that I’m a huge fan of a messy burger so when we stumbled on Googie Burger in Centennial Park, I had to stop and see what it was. Good thing it was lunch time because this place […]

The post On the Road: Googie Burger appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
This is another installment of Chow Down Orlando on the road, this time from Atlanta.

It’s pretty clear that I’m a huge fan of a messy burger so when we stumbled on Googie Burger in Centennial Park, I had to stop and see what it was. Good thing it was lunch time because this place looked like a winner.

This is the Googie Pig. Think a quality, Five Guys style burger with all the fixing, but tipped with honey-mustard BBQ pulled pork. Absolutely delicious.

Equally delicious were the onion rings which were like no onion rings I’ve ever had. Giant doesn’t even come close to describe the size of these things. Equal to the size is the taste. These things were battered and fried in what tasted like a fried chicken batter which was a completely different taste than expected, but in a really good way.

Googie Burger puts the typical Atlanta burger staple, The Varsity, to shame.

The post On the Road: Googie Burger appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
